# PHASE 1: Setup Slack Integration

## Install Slack CLI
```bash
#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "ğŸ” Checking for Slack CLI..."

if ! command -v slack &> /dev/null; then
  echo "ğŸ“¦ Installing Slack CLI..."
  
  # Download and install based on OS
  if [[ "$OSTYPE" == "darwin"* ]]; then
    curl -fsSL https://downloads.slack-edge.com/slack-cli/install.sh | bash
  elif [[ "$OSTYPE" == "linux-gnu"* ]]; then
    curl -fsSL https://downloads.slack-edge.com/slack-cli/install.sh | bash
  else
    echo "âŒ Please install Slack CLI manually from:"
    echo "https://api.slack.com/automation/cli/install"
    exit 1
  fi
fi

# Authenticate
if ! slack auth list 2>/dev/null | grep -q "Active"; then
  echo "ğŸ”‘ Authenticating with Slack..."
  slack login
fi

echo "âœ… Slack CLI ready"
```

## Configure Webhook (Alternative Method)
```bash
function setupSlackWebhook() {
  echo "ğŸ”§ Setting up Slack webhook..."
  
  # Check for existing webhook in .env
  if [ -f .env ] && grep -q "SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL" .env; then
    source .env
    echo "âœ… Found existing Slack webhook"
    return 0
  fi
  
  echo "ğŸ“ Please create a Slack webhook:"
  echo "1. Go to: https://api.slack.com/apps"
  echo "2. Create New App > From scratch"
  echo "3. Name it: '${REPO_NAME}-bot'"
  echo "4. Choose your workspace"
  echo "5. Go to: Incoming Webhooks > Activate"
  echo "6. Add New Webhook to Workspace"
  echo "7. Select or create channel: #${REPO_NAME}"
  echo "8. Copy the webhook URL"
  echo ""
  read -p "Enter Slack Webhook URL: " SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL
  
  # Save to .env
  echo "SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL=\"$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL\"" >> .env
  echo "âœ… Slack webhook configured"
}
```

# PHASE 2: Create Project Channel

## Auto-create Channel for Repository
```bash
function createProjectChannel() {
  # Get repo name
  if [ -d .git ]; then
    REPO_NAME=$(basename $(git config --get remote.origin.url) .git)
  else
    REPO_NAME=$(basename "$PWD")
  fi
  
  # Clean channel name (lowercase, no special chars)
  CHANNEL_NAME=$(echo "$REPO_NAME" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | tr -cd '[:alnum:]-')
  
  echo "ğŸ“¢ Creating Slack channel: #$CHANNEL_NAME"
  
  # Create channel using Slack CLI
  if command -v slack &> /dev/null; then
    slack channel create --name "$CHANNEL_NAME" --description "Development updates for $REPO_NAME"
  fi
  
  # Save channel to .env
  if ! grep -q "SLACK_CHANNEL" .env 2>/dev/null; then
    echo "SLACK_CHANNEL=\"#$CHANNEL_NAME\"" >> .env
  fi
  
  echo "âœ… Slack channel ready: #$CHANNEL_NAME"
}
```

# PHASE 3: Notification Functions

## Send Slack Message (MANDATORY)
```bash
function slackNotify() {
  local MESSAGE="$1"
  local THREAD_TS="${2:-}"
  local PRIORITY="${3:-normal}"  # normal, high, error
  
  # Load config
  source .env
  
  # Emoji based on priority
  case $PRIORITY in
    "high")
      EMOJI="ğŸš¨"
      ;;
    "error")
      EMOJI="âŒ"
      ;;
    "success")
      EMOJI="âœ…"
      ;;
    "start")
      EMOJI="ğŸš€"
      ;;
    "complete")
      EMOJI="âœ…"
      ;;
    *)
      EMOJI="ğŸ“"
      ;;
  esac
  
  # Format message with context
  FULL_MESSAGE="$EMOJI $MESSAGE

ğŸ“ Repo: $(basename $PWD)
ğŸŒ¿ Branch: $(git branch --show-current 2>/dev/null || echo 'main')
ğŸ‘¤ Agent: ${AGENT_NAME:-unknown}
â° Time: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')"
  
  # Send via webhook
  if [ -n "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL" ]; then
    curl -X POST "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL" \
      -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
      -d @- <<EOF
{
  "text": "$FULL_MESSAGE",
  "channel": "$SLACK_CHANNEL",
  "thread_ts": "$THREAD_TS"
}
EOF
  fi
  
  # Also use Slack CLI if available
  if command -v slack &> /dev/null; then
    slack message send \
      --channel "$SLACK_CHANNEL" \
      --text "$FULL_MESSAGE" \
      ${THREAD_TS:+--thread-ts "$THREAD_TS"}
  fi
}
```

# PHASE 8: Integration with All Agents

## Wrapper Function for ALL Agent Actions
```bash
function withSlackNotification() {
  local AGENT="$1"
  local ACTION="$2"
  local COMMAND="$3"
  
  # Start notification
  notifyAgentStart "$AGENT" "$ACTION"
  local START_TIME=$(date +%s)
  
  # Execute command
  eval "$COMMAND"
  local EXIT_CODE=$?
  
  # Calculate duration
  local END_TIME=$(date +%s)
  local DURATION=$((END_TIME - START_TIME))
  local DURATION_STR="$(($DURATION / 60))m $(($DURATION % 60))s"
  
  # Complete notification
  if [ $EXIT_CODE -eq 0 ]; then
    notifyAgentComplete "$AGENT" "$ACTION completed successfully" "$DURATION_STR"
  else
    notifyError "$ACTION failed with code $EXIT_CODE" "$COMMAND" "$AGENT"
  fi
  
  return $EXIT_CODE
}
```

# PHASE 9: Enforce in .env

## Add to .env Configuration
```bash
function enforceSlackConfig() {
  if [ ! -f .env ]; then
    echo "âŒ No .env file! Run /jira-setup first!"
    exit 1
  fi
  
  if ! grep -q "SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL" .env; then
    echo "âŒ No Slack configuration in .env!"
    setupSlackWebhook
  fi
  
  if ! grep -q "SLACK_NOTIFICATIONS_ENABLED" .env; then
    echo "SLACK_NOTIFICATIONS_ENABLED=true" >> .env
    echo "SLACK_NOTIFICATION_LEVEL=all" >> .env  # all, important, errors
  fi
}
```
